answers.answer: Im in the same situation.  With my first I was put under during my emergency c-section. I had a hard time processing every thing that happened after. I didnt get to hear my baby cry for the first time, feed him, hold him. I started going through depression over it. This time around I have the option of doing a vbac or c-section.  I just really want to be awake. My epidurals failed too with my first. I hope to hear other peoples response to your question too.

question: I'm 29w 4d with baby number 2 and as of now I am planning for a vbac.  I am anxious but scared at the same time.  I live in a new place and this hospital has a very high vbac success rate and my midwife has confidence that I will have more luck.  My first time around I was induced due to preeclampsia at 38 weeks.  Apparently after 36 hours of Labor and 2 failed epidurals my body just wasn't ready.  So I eneded up with a c section and a failed spinal block so I was put under.  So as you can imagine I'm kinda nervous!!  I'm just looking for advice and what to look forward to whether you had success or 	not I hope to hear everything!  Thanks ladies!
title: vbac stories or advice? scared mommy!!
